about_the_game:
Eon is a small, fun, fast-paced, challenging game of cellular conflict.

The goal is to conquer a 7x7 grid by either eliminating the opposing colors destructively or by displacing them from the board.

The tools at your disposal, shared equally with your AI opponents, consist of two simple mechanics:
  • Taking a neighboring cell as your own
  • Sacrificing your cells to affect the surrounding cells

As levels progress gameplay evolves, incorporating additional, smarter, and faster AI players, and a variety of dynamic obstacles.

Being a small game, once mastered the average play session surpassing level 10 lasts around fifteen minutes. It's good for a quick distraction that starts slow and easy before becoming frenetic and difficult.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Anything recent supporting SDL2
  • Processor: 1.2Ghz
  • Memory: 32 MB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 2.1
  • Storage: 20 MB available space
  • Sound Card: SDL2 compatible (most)
  • Additional Notes: Should work on any PC from the last ~10 years w/GPU-accelerated OpenGL. Linux support is native and first-class, no Wine/Proton needed.

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 10.11
  • Processor: 1.2Ghz
  • Memory: 32 MB RAM
  • Graphics: OpenGL 2.1
  • Storage: 20 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: Catalina may pose problems, the executable is not notarized at this time. Also, using a multi-button mouse is highly recommended.
